plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A species of rose native to Southwest China, known for continuously blooming throughout the growing season in warm climates. It bears fragrant, multicolored flowers often used in hybrid tea roses.
plants.location: Subtropical and temperate regions worldwide, especially East Asia and cultivated gardens globally
plants.funFact: China Roses were instrumental in the development of modern rose cultivars, introducing the ability to bloom repeatedly during the season.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America, featuring tall spikes covered in pea-like blue to purple flowers.
plants.location: Sandy soils of eastern United States and southern Canada
plants.funFact: Wild lupines are crucial for the endangered Karner blue butterfly as they serve as host plants for its larvae.

plants.name: Wisteria sinensis
plants.description: A woody climbing vine known for its heavy clusters of fragrant, pendulous flowers that bloom in spring before the leaves fully emerge.
plants.location: Native to China, cultivated in temperate zones worldwide
plants.funFact: Chinese Wisteria can live for decades and bloom profusely; some specimens planted over 100 years ago are still flowering beautifully.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A flowering tree with bright red, spiky flowers shaped like a rooster's crest, native to South America and loved as an ornamental tree in subtropical climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to early Summer (September to November in Southern Hemisphere)
plants.location: Native to Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil; blooms in Southern Hemisphere spring during May
plants.funFact: Erythrina crista-galli is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.
